title: Page wont show google analytics
content:
I have to use a specific page for work and the users have a google analytics monitor on their control panel. Even if I have deletes cookies on all pages related to the control panel it still wont show. I have even reset firefox, but it still won't show up.

If I use incognito browser it comes up, but when using my regular firefox it is still stuck on the old page (as my old profil picture shows up). I've even deleted everything, but still stuck on old page.
creator: annchristin86

title: VIDEOJS: ERROR: (CODE:4 MEDIA_ERR_SRC_NOT_SUPPORTED) The media could not be loaded, either because the server or network failed or because the format is not supported. On Windows (localhost)
content:
Hello, I am getting below error when running a website on localhost, while when the same site runs in production, it seems to work fine, no errors.

creator: intelligentjimmy

title: Create allow list for Safe Browsing
content:
Dear Support

I'm trying to launch a phishing awareness campaign in my company. The phishing awareness webpage needs to resemble an actual phishing page to see which users would enter their credentials.

Both Google Chrome and FireFox are protected by Google Safe Browsing which (correctly) flags the webpage as phishing. I'm aware that sites which are incorrectly flagged could be appealed, but the site is meant to masquerade as a phishing website.

That's why I would like to create an exception for the company users to be able to access this specific webpage without the red screen warning the user.

On Google Chrome, I was able to download the GPO and edit the allow list for safe browsing: GPO: https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/187202?hl=en#zippy=%2Cwindows GPO Safe Browsing setting: https://admx.help/?Category=Chrome&Policy=Google.Policies.Chrome::SafeBrowsingAllowlistDomains

I tried to do the same thing for Firefox: GPO: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/customizing-firefox-using-group-policy-windows

I downloaded the Policy template for Firefox 96 (template v3.5) but I couldn't find an option to configure an allow list for safe browsing. I don't want to weaken the overall security by disabling safe browsing altogether.

Are there any other options I could take, or is there simply no way to configure safe browsing settings for Firefox?

Best Regards Andrea
creator: Andrea_6767

title: Couldn't load a page. Then tried Google Chrome and had no problem
content:
Hello,

I wanted to watch a video at https://abc.com/shows/general-hospital/episode-guide/2022-01/18-general-hospital-11822 but encountered this message: “An error occurred during video playback, possibly due to network connectivity or being in a backgrounded browser tab. Please try again.”

I tried several times and cleared all the cookies from that site. Still wasn't able to watch it. Then I switched to Google Chrome and had no problem. After I watched the show I came back to FF and tried it again. Still got that same message. I've had this problem many times before with from abc.com.

What's up with this?

Thanks, Andre'a
creator: DreaSpirit

title: Cannot type accents anymore
content:
Since the last update (I think) I lost the ability to type in accented letters in Firefox. Other applications work ok. I have a German keyboard, so "è" is obtained by pressing "`" and then "e".

When I do that, the sentence "È una bella giornata. E lì?" becomes "E una bella giornata, E li?"

(I typed this elsewhere an copy-pasted it)

Currently on Firefox 96.0 on Ubuntu
creator: simonecesano

title: Firefox BLOCK Auto Play not working for all sites
content:
Websites like YouTube and Twitter, seem to ignore the Firefox preference to block Auto play. ( Why am I not surprised) I especially hate the auto-play videos that play without sound. So I not only have to unmute the video, I also have to manual adjust the video slider to the start of the video. How I want my web experience to be, I press a play button when I decide to watch the video. BUT NO! that's to hard for the internet.

I would like to know the about:config settings to change, to stop this nuisance behavior.

Thank you in advance :)
creator: farcry881

title: Firefox crashed and crash popup window froze - wouldn't allow me to uncheck authorization box
content:
Hello,

Firefox recently crashed and a popup window appeared asking if I wanted to restart, and there was a box that was already checked allowing my authorization to report the incident and allowing Mozilla to use the results of the crash to help make Firefox better. I tried to uncheck the box, as I prefer to not share the information, but the window was frozen, and I had to cycle the power in my laptop to reinitialize Firefox.

Given the instability with the crash and the frozen window I'm not sure if the incident ended up being reported or not, but I didn't authorize that the incident be reported and I don't authorize Mozilla to use the information in any way. I would appreciate it if you could help to ensure that my information remains private. Security is one of the main reasons that I use Firefox.

Thanks, Rob Reiner
creator: Rob_reiner

title: Declare a custom theme "light"
content: As of recently, Firefox adapts some elements (basically everything in the toolbar, like the downloads or browsing history) depending on whether it identifies the theme you use as light or dark. I am using a custom theme (this one: https://addons.mozilla.org/de/firefox/addon/tardis/?utm_source=addons.mozilla.org&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=search) that Firefox identifies as dark, however I absolutely hate any form of dark mode. So far I figured out how to force Firefox to use a light theme everywhere else using about:config, but I couldn't figure out how to change the abovementioned elemtents back to light without changing the theme. So is there any way to declare a theme as light or some other way to change this behavior?
creator: frasiwa
